channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-13005] TestDeleteTableHandler failing in 0.98 hadoop 1 builds
item.description: Stabilize the test or revert the change containing it.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Failed twice:
https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-0.98-on-Hadoop-1.1/799/
https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-0.98-on-Hadoop-1.1/800/
And here too: https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-0.98-on-Hadoop-1.1/801
Andrew Purtell What you think broke it? HBASE-12980?
That's the issue that added the test in 0.98. I think the test only works with HDFS 2. Planning to look at it tomorrow.
IIRC, I added second test to an existing test. Is it this existing test that is failing? If so, you could purge it and 0.98 would be as it was?

The file you added the test to did not exist in 0.98 so I made a new unit and added the test as the single new case. There might be something real here in that it works with HDFS 2 but apparently not with HDFS 1.
Passes locally, sadly. Looking into a timing issue of some kind
Let's try adding a bit of time after the delete completes without introducing a sleep and also grab a new table reference to META.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12698187/HBASE-13005-0.98.patch
against 0.98 branch at commit 3dd220f8fdf6e34e11ffa309ff182172f6346091.
ATTACHMENT ID: 12698187

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 4 new or modified tests.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

-1 javadoc. The javadoc tool appears to have generated 23 warning messages.

+1 checkstyle. The applied patch does not increase the total number of checkstyle errors

-1 findbugs. The patch appears to introduce 5 new Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings.

-1 release audit. The applied patch generated 42 release audit warnings (more than the master's current 0 warnings).

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:

Resubmit

This message is automatically generated.
Ignore the other stuff in the QA report for now, the unit tests passed. What do you think stack? I'd like to commit and see if this helps the hadoop 1 0.98 build.
Try it. +1
Pushed, let's see if the builds look better before resolving.

SUCCESS: Integrated in HBase-0.98 #849 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-0.98/849/)
HBASE-13005 TestDeleteTableHandler failing in 0.98 hadoop 1 builds (apurtell: rev 4ee823b3f2dd33551e9481ebbad2dee4a2a1ebd6)

  • hbase-server/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/master/handler/TestDeleteTableHandler.java

FAILURE: Integrated in HBase-0.98-on-Hadoop-1.1 #807 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-0.98-on-Hadoop-1.1/807/)
HBASE-13005 TestDeleteTableHandler failing in 0.98 hadoop 1 builds (apurtell: rev 4ee823b3f2dd33551e9481ebbad2dee4a2a1ebd6)

  • hbase-server/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/master/handler/TestDeleteTableHandler.java

No effect. I will resolve this by removing the test. Unfortunate, but the world really doesn't use Hadoop 1, it passes on the Hadoop 2 build, the functionality reads correct after code review, and it fixes a real problem.
Attaching the addendum I'd like to commit.

FAILURE: Integrated in HBase-0.98-on-Hadoop-1.1 #810 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-0.98-on-Hadoop-1.1/810/)
Amend HBASE-13005 TestDeleteTableHandler failing in 0.98 hadoop 1 builds (apurtell: rev a6e4b3ba33b5dba4096ac29b2fddb13e208cee31)

  • hbase-server/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/master/handler/TestDeleteTableHandler.java
I'm going to commit this removal of the test I added for the above mentioned rationale shortly unless objection, so after the addendum on HBASE-9531 we might have a clean 0.98 Hadoop 1 build again.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment

This issue was closed as part of a bulk closing operation on 2015-11-20. All issues that have been resolved and where all fixVersions have been released have been closed (following discussions on the mailing list).
